Line Item description (company language): iPhone revenue includes net sales from Apple's iPhone products, with increases in 2025 primarily due to higher sales of Pro models. This revenue line reflects the sales of iPhone devices as reported in the company's disaggregated net sales tables.

Services net sales include amortization of the deferred value of services bundled in the sales price of certain products, and are driven by revenue from sources such as advertising, the App Store, and cloud services.

Wearables, Home and Accessories net sales include revenue from Apple's wearable devices, home products, and related accessories. Net sales in this category decreased during 2025 compared to 2024 primarily due to lower net sales of Accessories and Wearables.
The Mac revenue line includes net sales from the Company's line of Mac computers, such as MacBook Pro, Mac mini, iMac, MacBook Air, and Mac Studio, as announced during the fiscal year.

The iPad revenue line includes net sales from various iPad models, with increases in 2025 primarily driven by higher net sales of iPad Air, iPad mini, and iPad, partially offset by lower net sales of iPad Pro.

Server products and cloud services revenue includes sales from Azure and other cloud services, as well as server products, and is part of the Intelligent Cloud segment. This revenue line is driven by demand for Microsoft's portfolio of cloud and server offerings.

Revenue Line: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services
Line Item description (company language): Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services revenue includes sales of Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud offerings and related products, driven by seat growth in small and medium businesses, frontline worker offerings, and increased revenue per user, as well as on-premises components and Office transactional sales.

Gaming revenue within the More Personal Computing segment includes revenue from Xbox content and services, comprising first- and third-party content (including games and in-game content), Xbox Game Pass and other subscriptions, and Xbox Cloud Gaming.

LinkedIn connects the worldâ€™s professionals to make them more productive and successful and transforms the way companies hire, market, sell, and learn. LinkedIn revenue includes offerings that support professional networking, hiring, marketing, sales, and learning solutions.
Windows and Devices revenue includes sales of Windows Pro and non-Pro licenses sold through the OEM channel and sales of first-party Devices, including Surface and PC accessories.
Search and news advertising revenue consists of sales from online advertising, including advertising on Microsoft's search and news platforms, and is part of the More Personal Computing segment.
Dynamics products and cloud services revenue includes revenue from Microsoft's Dynamics business solutions, with growth primarily driven by Dynamics 365.

Enterprise and partner services revenue includes services provided to enterprise customers and partners, as classified separately from product and cloud service revenues in Microsoft's financial reporting.

Revenue Line: Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services
Line Item description (company language): Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services revenue includes revenue from Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions, Office Consumer products, and is influenced by demand for communication and storage services such as Outlook.com and OneDrive, as well as the shift from Office licensed on-premises to cloud-based subscriptions.
The 'Other' revenue line includes revenue not classified under the company's significant product and service offerings, representing a small portion of total revenue.
Google Search & other includes revenues generated on Google search properties, including revenues from traffic generated by search distribution partners who use Google.
Google Cloud revenues primarily include revenues from Google Cloud Platform, largely from infrastructure services.

Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices revenues are comprised of consumer subscriptions (primarily from YouTube services such as YouTube TV, YouTube Music and Premium, NFL Sunday Ticket, and Google One), platforms (primarily revenues from Google Play sales of apps and in-app purchases), devices (sales of the Pixel family of devices), and other products and services.

YouTube ads revenue consists of advertising revenues generated from YouTube, including brand advertising products and direct response advertising products, both of which benefited from increased advertiser spending.
Google Network revenues are part of Google advertising revenues within Google Services, but the specific components or nature of Google Network are not detailed in the provided chunks.

Other Bets is a combination of multiple operating segments that are not individually material, and revenues from Other Bets are generated primarily from the sale of healthcare-related services and internet services.

The 'Online stores' revenue line includes sales to consumers through Amazon's online stores, offering hundreds of millions of unique products sold by Amazon and third parties across dozens of product categories. Customers access these offerings through Amazon's websites and mobile apps.

Subscription services revenue includes digital media content subscriptions that provide unlimited viewing or usage rights. This encompasses media products available in both physical and digital formats, such as books, videos, games, music, and software.
Physical stores revenue includes sales to consumers through Amazon's physical retail locations, focusing on selection, price, and convenience across dozens of product categories.

Advertising revenue in the Family of Apps segment is generated by displaying ad products on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and third-party mobile applications and websites, with marketers paying based on impressions delivered or user actions such as clicks.

Reality Labs revenue is generated from the delivery of consumer hardware products, such as Meta Quest and Ray-Ban Meta AI glasses, and related software and content, including virtual, augmented, and mixed reality related consumer hardware, software, and content.
Other revenue in the Family of Apps segment includes revenue sources other than advertising, but the specific components of this revenue line are not detailed in the provided information.

The Compute revenue line includes revenue from data center compute platforms for accelerated computing and AI solutions, driven by demand for architectures such as Hopper and Blackwell, and used in applications like large language models, recommendation engines, and generative AI.
The Networking revenue line includes revenue from Data Center networking, which grew 51% driven by Ethernet for AI revenue, including the Spectrum-X end-to-end ethernet platform.

The Gaming revenue line within the Graphics segment includes revenue from products sold to customers such as AIBs, distributors, ODMs, OEMs, and system integrators. This segment's revenue is driven by the sale of graphics products for gaming applications.
Professional Visualization revenue includes sales of Ada RTX GPU workstations used for generative AI-powered design, simulation, and engineering.
Automotive revenue for fiscal year 2025 was up 55% from a year ago, driven by sales of our self-driving platforms.
